column4: I cloned my /sda1 (my 10.04  / partition) to /sda2 - how can i teach grub about this so it lets me choose which system to boot into when i start my PC?
do you have a bootable OS wth grub2 now?
yes sure, i boot standardly into 10.04 which sits on sda1
and i used gparted to clone sda1 to sda2, so basically would like to get a multi boot system
if you still want sda1 and access to sda2 run sudo update-grub in sda1, if you want to remove sda1 the you can get in after the update and install grub to the mbr from sda2.
yes, i want them both to be available as seperate systems that live on sda1 and sda2, and i can choose which one to boot into when booting the computer. will look into update-grub - thanks
no prblem, it is easy to load grub to the mbr from the OS if needed one command.
actually the problem is the UUID is the same for both from the clone, not sure of a fix really.
tune-fs can be used to assign a new uuid to a partition thankfully
cool I wasn't thinking about the UID on the grub issue my bad.
you know how to find the UUID right?
cool, sounds like you will have it fixed pronto.
ou have to run a update-grub when you change stuff like you have, as of now sda1 has the boot persay.
if you want sda2 to control the boot from sda2 run sudo grub-install /dev/sda  then update-grub

i did, and it says correctly that it found a 10.04 installation on sda1 and sda2, but then doesnt add it to the list of choices one gets when the computer first starts. Do i need to manually add boot entries to the grub configuration, or should grub automatically pick available os installed into my different partitions?
you could but I have to wonder why you want identical OS ?

basically i want to setup sda1 the way i want with all my customizations. then clone it to sda2. When i then for some reason bork the System on sda1, i can still boot into sda2 and maybe fix my sda1 system.
